ResourceHeader.Description: The composition and concentration of thermal positive ions in the ionosphere of Venus were determined and interpreted in terms of vertical and horizontal components. The instrument used was a Bennett radio-frequency mass spectrometer based on the design of those flown on OGO and Atmospheric Explorer satellites. A mass range of 1--60 amu was covered with a variety of automatic scan-search modes available.
